//Imperial Needle
//notes: adam (PvE 1 / primary use / optimal): Lightweight bows have a draw time stat cap of 540. Elastic String gets you to this cap by itself, making a draw time MW useless. If you don't have Elastic String on your roll, a Draw Time MW also becomes valuable. The best min/max combo is Polymer String with a Draw Time MW, as it results in a couple points of extra Accuracy but it's not worth losing sleep over, the main thing that matters is reaching the Draw Time cap. Archer's Tempo does give an increase beyond the cap of 540, but only a minor oneâ€”its benefits are more noticable if you haven't reached that cap, so if you have reached the cap with any combination of String + MW stat bonuses, the reload increase from Impulse Amplifier probably gives you a slightly higher DPS increase.|tags:PvE

//Brass Attacks
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): 3 taps to the body below 10 resilience. 2-taps with Rampage x1 if you hit all crits. Surprise Attack works in crucible now, allows 2-taps with just a single crit hit out of the 4 bullets on the two double bursts. Can be a very strong shutdown tool to people running at you with shotguns, don't sleep on it.|tags:PvP

//Threaded Needle
//notes: adam (PvE / boss DPS / optimal): Slot 2 is a tricky one with LFRs: Accelerated coils gives you the best DPS, Ionized Battery the best total damage for a single mag, Liquid Coils is a middle-ground option with more total damage than Accelerated, and faster reloads than Ionized. There is no clear winner here, the best one will be situational based on the length of the damage phase (can you empty all your ammo despite a reload penalty? â€” if so, Ionized Mag is the winner) and how much damage you need to do (if you don't need to go out of your way to optimize total damage output, take Accelerated)|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=3075224551&perks=839105230,689005463,2869569095,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=3075224551&perks=839105230,1483536627,2869569095,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=3075224551&perks=689005463,2869569095,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=3075224551&perks=1483536627,2869569095,1546637391

//Threaded Needle
//notes: adam (PvE / boss DPS): Slot 2 is a tricky one with LFRs: Accelerated coils gives you the best DPS, Ionized Battery the best total damage for a single mag, Liquid Coils is a middle-ground option with more total damage than Accelerated, and faster reloads than Ionized. There is no clear winner here, the best one will be situational based on the length of the damage phase (can you empty all your ammo despite a reload penalty? â€” if so, Ionized Mag is the winner) and how much damage you need to do (if you don't need to go out of your way to optimize total damage output, take Accelerated)|tags:PvE

//Code Duello
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): This is your new best friend. Can also do boss dps if you swap back and forth with Izanagi.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=2496242052&perks=3525010810,3796465595,3300816228,3927722942

dimwishlist:item=2496242052&perks=3796465595,3300816228,3927722942
dimwishlist:item=2496242052&perks=3300816228,3927722942

//Code Duello
//notes: adam (PvE / boss DPS / optimal): Field prep maxes reload speed as long as you're crouched. You're most likely going to use this one in a sustained raid boss phase, where you're usually stationary in a well, so staying crouched shouldn't be an issue. Impulse Amplifier also gives a reload buff, the extent of which I'm not sure about, but even if it maxes reload similar to field prep, the extra reserves granted by Field Prep greatly increase your total damage potential, making it a superior choice.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=2496242052&perks=3796465595,2869569095,3927722942
dimwishlist:item=2496242052&perks=2869569095,3927722942

//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content / optimal): Subsistence is great on hand cannons when used for general add clear. By default, this gun gets 1 bullet back for every kill with subsistenceâ€”however, a mag increase in Slot 2 can push that to 2 per kill, which should guarantee an infinite mag without ever having to reload.  That being said, I would look for the High PL Content roll, which covers all PvE situations really well.|tags:PvE

//The Palindrome
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): One For All is a no-brainer as a GM damage perk. Subsistence would be extremely punishing partly because of the hit your reserves take, and with how tanky enemies are, you'd need to use more bullets per kill than what is auto-reloaded in return. Due to how hard it can be to kill GM enemies with a primary (and with the RNG-factor involved with Overflow), it should be worth stacking reload stat increases in Slot 2 and with your Masterwork in case you can't proc your reload perk.|tags:PvE

//The Palindrome (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content / optimal): Subsistence feels viable on hand cannons, if you use them to clear add waves. By default, this gun gets 1 bullet back for every kill with subsistenceâ€”however, a mag increase in Slot 2 can push that to 2 per kill, which should guarantee an infinite mag without ever having to reload. Keep in mind though that the higher your mag, the more subsistence lowers your total reserves. That being said, I would look for the roll below, which covers both easy red bar clear and difficult content as well.|tags:PvE

That being said, I would look for the roll below, which covers both easy red bar clear and difficult content as well.|tags:PvE

//The Palindrome (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): One For All is a no-brainer as a GM damage perk. Subsistence would be extremely punishing partly because of the hit your reserves take, and with how tanky enemies are, you'd need to use more bullets per kill than what is auto-reloaded in return. Due to how hard it can be to kill GM enemies with a primary (and with the RNG-factor involved with Overflow), it should be worth stacking reload stat increases in Slot 2 and with your Masterwork in case you can't proc your reload perk.|tags:PvE

//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): You won't be able to get any real benefits out of Feeding Frenzy in a GM; Overflow could guarantee easy champion stuns without having to worry about mag size.  Disruption Break is great if you use this as an Anti-Barrier utility weapon (your kinetic special deals more damage to the champion after the stun) while One For All is a strong damage perk that makes the weapon more viable against the adds in the nightfall. Choose your preference accordingly.|tags:PvE

//Shadow Price (Adept)
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): You won't be able to get any real benefits out of Feeding Frenzy in a GM; Overflow could guarantee easy champion stuns without having to worry about mag size.  Disruption Break is great if you use this as an Anti-Barrier utility weapon (your kinetic special deals more damage to the champion after the stun) while One For All is a strong damage perk that makes the weapon more viable against the adds in the nightfall. Choose your preference accordingly.|tags:PvE

//Xenoclast IV
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): As always, Smoothbore in Slot 1 is a hard no for any pvp shotgun. Otherwise, Killing Wind is probably the most interesting thing here. With the +20 intrinsic mobility buff from lightweight frames, and the 6-second +50 mobility buff from Killing Wind, you could pair this with the Powerful Friends mod (also +20) to have 100 effective mobility after a kill with just 10 mobility on your armor set, allowing you to focus your armor on other stats. Hunters can pair it with Dragon's Shadow, which gives +50 mobility for 10 seconds after a dodge to make it even more consistent, giving that 100 effective mobility even before the kill. Dragon's Shadow lets you secure the kill more easily, Killing Wind can extend the mobility buff while Dragon's Shadow is on cooldown, making for a good loop.|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=2891672170&perks=1047830412,791862061,3161816588,2450788523
dimwishlist:item=2891672170&perks=1047830412,791862061,3161816588,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=2891672170&perks=1047830412,791862061,1866048759,2450788523
dimwishlist:item=2891672170&perks=1047830412,791862061,1866048759,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=2891672170&perks=1047830412,791862061,2450788523
dimwishlist:item=2891672170&perks=1047830412,791862061,2726471870

//Xenoclast IV
//notes: adam (PvP): As always, Smoothbore in Slot 1 is a hard no for any pvp shotgun. Otherwise, Killing Wind is probably the most interesting thing here. With the +20 intrinsic mobility buff from lightweight frames, and the 6-second +50 mobility buff from Killing Wind, you could pair this with the Powerful Friends mod (also +20) to have 100 effective mobility after a kill with just 10 mobility on your armor set, allowing you to focus your armor on other stats. Hunters can pair it with Dragon's Shadow, which gives +50 mobility for 10 seconds after a dodge to make it even more consistent, giving that 100 effective mobility even before the kill. Dragon's Shadow lets you secure the kill more easily, Killing Wind can extend the mobility buff while Dragon's Shadow is on cooldown, making for a good loop.|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=2891672170&perks=1047830412,3142289711,3161816588,2450788523

//The Keening
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): Rapid Hit is easier to stack when enemies don't die in two shots, which makes reload stat increases less essential. At the same time, you can't safely be in the adds' vicinity in GM, so I'm favoring range stat increases on the first two slots here.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=409551876&perks=3250034553,679225683,247725512,4049631843

//Stars In Shadow
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): This archetype synergizes well with Headseeker, giving you a more forgiving 2-burst kill: 2 shots to the body and 4 to the head will down any guardian below 8 resilience. So if you aim around the oppponent's head and land the first shot in each burst on the body, Headseeker gives you a 2-burst kill.|tags:PvP

//Frozen Orbit
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): Primarily recommend this for GMs, as Rapid-Fire Frames outclass Aggressives when it comes to pure DPS, even with Vorpal factored in. However, more damage per bullet makes Aggressives very strong in a GM context where ammo economy can play a big role. Appended Mag is my recommended option in Slot 2 as it gives +1 mag increase by itself and +2 combined with a Backup Mag mod. Tactical Mag will give +1 by itself along with a reload speed buff, but Backup Mag doesn't buff it past that, recommend using Boss/Major spec with it instead.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=3473290087&perks=1840239774,1087426260,3300816228,1546637391

//Frozen Orbit
//notes: adam (PvE): Primarily recommend this for GMs, as Rapid-Fire Frames outclass Aggressives when it comes to pure DPS, even with Vorpal factored in. However, more damage per bullet makes Aggressives very strong in a GM context where ammo economy can play a big role. Appended Mag is my recommended option in Slot 2 as it gives +1 mag increase by itself and +2 combined with a Backup Mag mod. Tactical Mag will give +1 by itself along with a reload speed buff, but Backup Mag doesn't buff it past that, recommend using Boss/Major spec with it instead.|tags:PvE

//Frozen Orbit
//notes: adam (PvP / general use / optimal): Probably the best PvP sniper at the moment. It's an Aggressive Frame with Snapshot (the most essential sniper perk after the Quickdraw nerf), giving you instant body shot kills with any damage buff depending on the opponent's resilience. Without a buff, body shots will still do enough damage to allow instant cleanups with your primary.|tags:PvP

//Frozen Orbit
//notes: adam (PvP / for aggressive body shot chaining): Just like Tatara Gaze before it, this gun can give you the fearsome Aggressive Frame + Kill Clip combo, which lets you 1-tap to the body as long as Kill Clip is active. With the right rhythm, you can reactivate the perk after successive kills, taking out entire teams with just body shots.|tags:PvP

//Bottom Dollar
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): Explosive Payload is desirable for GM not only because the lack of damage falloff on the explosion lets you deal more damage when engaging from afar, but also because it allows champion stuns to happen when shooting the ground near the enemy, a particularly useful trick for Unstoppable Phalanxes whose toes are unprotected by their shields.|tags:PvE

//Bottom Dollar
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): Rangefinder combined with the high base range on 120s frees you up to focus on stability boosts in the first two columns. Without RF, you might want to split those stats between range and stability based on personal preference. Slot 4 will depend on your playstyle: Opening Shot gets you an additional range cushion similar to Rangefinder, and helps guarantee that first hit, which can be enough to scare opponents into panic plays considering how much damage 120s deal. Explosive Payload flinches the opponent like few other things. Rampage lets you 2-tap anyone after just one kill but you need to be an aggressive player who doesn't seek cover after downing an opponent.|tags:PvP

//Crowd Pleaser
//notes: adam (PvE / boss DPS / optimal): The damage increase from Spike Grenades increases as your blast radius decreases. Because of this, your DPS will take a hit with any Slot 1 perk that increases blast radius, or with a blast radius MW.  Field Prep gives you the best traditional reload speed but Pulse Monitor can max DPS: if you fire the last shot in the mag at your feet while standing in a Well, you get an instant reload. Slot 4 has the least impact here but Demolitionist can get you a free reload (or multiple if you use Starfire Protocol) during a damage phase, slightly increasing your overall DPS.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=981914802,3301904089,2869569095,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=981914802,3301904089,972757866,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=981914802,3301904089,2869569095
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=981914802,3301904089,972757866
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=3301904089,2869569095,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=3301904089,972757866,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=3301904089,2869569095
dimwishlist:item=3565520715&perks=3301904089,972757866

//Crowd Pleaser
//notes: adam (PvE / boss DPS): The damage increase from Spike Grenades increases as your blast radius decreases. Field Prep gives you the best traditional reload speed but Pulse Monitor can max DPS: if you fire the last shot in the mag at your feet while standing in a Well, you get an instant reload. Slot 4 has the least impact here but Demolitionist can get you a free reload (or multiple if you use Starfire Protocol) during a damage phase, slightly increasing your overall DPS.|tags:PvE

//Multimach CCX
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): Difficult to pin down an obvious god roll with this one (inspect your roll, even if it's wishlisted!). Its perk pool allows you to create combinations that result in either the highest range or the highest stability SMG in the game. This archetype really needs you to hit your crits (as it sports the fastest optimal TTK but the slowest body shot TTK among SMGs) which means you should only go for the range stacking if you're fully confident in your ability to control against recoil. You could try stacking enough range stat boosts to counteract the penalty from Iron Gaze, which would yield an average range gun with really high aim assist. At the end of the day, the most reliable option for quickplay might just be Kill Clip with a balanced stat distribution (and an SMG in 3v3 doesn't feel viable).|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=3717177717&perks=663495154,1431678320,2450788523,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=3717177717&perks=663495154,1431678320,2450788523,11551321
dimwishlist:item=3717177717&perks=663495154,1431678320,1359896290,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=3717177717&perks=663495154,1431678320,1359896290,11551321

//Multimach CCX
//notes: adam (PvP): Difficult to pin down an obvious god roll with this one (inspect your roll, even if it's wishlisted!). Its perk pool allows you to create combinations that result in either the highest range or the highest stability SMG in the game. This archetype really needs you to hit your crits (as it sports the fastest optimal TTK but the slowest body shot TTK among SMGs) which means you should only go for the range stacking if you're fully confident in your ability to control against recoil. You could try stacking enough range stat boosts to counteract the penalty from Iron Gaze, which would yield an average range gun with really high aim assist. At the end of the day, the most reliable option for quickplay might just be Kill Clip with a balanced stat distribution (and an SMG in 3v3 doesn't feel viable).|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=3717177717&perks=663495154,1431678320,4071163871,1015611457

//The Time-Worn Spire
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): Counterbalance mod on this makes the recoil go completely vertical, highly recommended. Pair Moving Target with a Pulse Targeting mod on your helmet for 99 aim assist, and you have a beast. A truly perfect roll would have one of the long rifle zooms and a shorter zoom as the Slot 1 options, that way you can respec based on the map you are playing on. Long zooms get preference though because of the huge range boost they provide.|tags:PvP

//The Steady Hand
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): You are ideally looking for a combo between Slot 1, Slot 2, and the Masterwork that lets you boost both range and stability. Try to reach 60+ stability and 70+ range if possible. Moving Target adds +10 to aim assist, pair this with Hand Cannon Targeting on your helmet for a ridiculous 90 aim assist stat.|tags:PvP

//The Fool's Remedy
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): Iron Gaze seems like a pretty bad tradeoff on paper, until you realize that due to their positioning as a close-quarters primary, sidearms only get minor increases from that stat. The actual distance loss from Iron Gaze is only 1 meter, and in exchange you get a gun that can hit a full 100 aim assist stat if you combine it with Moving Target and a Targeting mod on your helmet (still 93 without Moving Target, and you get the hip-fire benefit). It's a unique roll that synergizes extremely well with this particular weapon type, and should feel amazing for controller players. Your other option is Iron Grip for that stability boost, which provides another way of helping you hit your shots.|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755706,1885400500,588594999,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755706,1885400500,1866048759,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755706,1561002382,588594999,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755706,1561002382,1866048759,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755707,1885400500,588594999,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755707,1885400500,1866048759,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755707,1561002382,588594999,4152709778

//The Fool's Remedy
//notes: adam (PvP): Iron Gaze seems like a pretty bad tradeoff on paper, until you realize that due to their positioning as a close-quarters primary, sidearms only get minor increases from that stat. The actual distance loss from Iron Gaze is only 1 meter, and in exchange you get a gun that can hit a full 100 aim assist stat if you combine it with Moving Target and a Targeting mod on your helmet (still 93 without Moving Target, and you get the hip-fire benefit). It's a unique roll that synergizes extremely well with this particular weapon type, and should feel amazing for controller players. Your other option is Iron Grip for that stability boost, which provides another way of helping you hit your shots.|tags:PvP

//Trustee
//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content / optimal): I am leaning towards Outlaw on a general PvE roll, since you might not have enough downtime on your primary to give enough time for Reconstruction to do its job. That being said, the right mag perks can give you a good enough reload speed that you can get by without Outlaw, and take advantage of that double mag. Don't be fooled by the rarity and novelty on Redirection, it's a weak buff and I'd always pick Wellspring over it. Lastly, avoid the Reconstruction + High-Impact Reserves combo, as the latter only procs on the second half of your *base* mag, and the auto-refill from Reconstruction means you might never get it to proc. Try to get Arrowhead Brake to stabilize the pretty bad recoil deviation on this weapon.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,106909392,1168162263,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,3177308360,1168162263,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,1087426260,1168162263,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,106909392,1168162263
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,3177308360,1168162263
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,1087426260,1168162263
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,1168162263,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,1168162263

//Trustee
//notes: adam (PvE / regular, non-endgame content): I am leaning towards Outlaw on a general PvE roll, since you might not have enough downtime on your primary to give enough time for Reconstruction to do its job. That being said, the right mag perks can give you a good enough reload speed that you can get by without Outlaw, and take advantage of that double mag. Don't be fooled by the rarity and novelty on Redirection, it's a weak buff and I'd always pick Wellspring over it. Lastly, avoid the Reconstruction + High-Impact Reserves combo, as the latter only procs on the second half of your *base* mag, and the auto-refill from Reconstruction means you might never get it to proc. Try to get Arrowhead Brake to stabilize the pretty bad recoil deviation on this weapon.|tags:PvE

//Trustee
//notes: adam (PvE / high PL content, GMs / optimal): The double mag from Reconstruction should be more useful in GMs, both for champion stuns and for whittling down tankier enemies. Also, you will have your special and heavy out for far longer in these activities, which lets the auto-refill tick up in the background. Redirection should be somewhat more useful here, but you're still much better off using your special on a GM elite. It's a passive benefit, which is always great, but a very minor one. Once again, try to get Arrowhead Brake to stabilize the pretty bad recoil deviation on this weapon.|tags:PvE

Redirection should be somewhat more useful here, but you're still much better off using your special on a GM elite. It's a passive benefit, which is always great, but a very minor one. //Trustee
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): Nothing fancy here: Opening Shot gets you that first hit, or High-Impact Reserves can provide a faster TTK if you fire off the first half of your mag before engaging. Past that, you're just looking for a good stat split that makes the gun feel good for you.|tags:PvP

//Succession
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): Extended Mag + Reconstruction + a Backup Mag mod gets you 10 shots in the mag, basically removing the need for reloads entirely. Osmosis is an extremely powerful tool on this weapon due to its archetype's viability in end-game activities, where Match Game is often enabled. With Osmosis, you get a lot of loadout versatility, and could easily cover all 3 shield elements with your weapons. For damage perks, I personally prefer Vorpal's reliability over Recombination's more powerful buff with its limited uptime.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=2990047042&perks=839105230,2420895100,1523832109,1546637391

//Succession
//notes: adam (PvE): Extended Mag + Reconstruction + a Backup Mag mod gets you 10 shots in the mag, basically removing the need for reloads entirely. Osmosis is an extremely powerful tool on this weapon due to its archetype's viability in end-game activities, where Match Game is often enabled. With Osmosis, you get a lot of loadout versatility, and could easily cover all 3 shield elements with your weapons. For damage perks, I personally prefer Vorpal's reliability over Recombination's more powerful buff with its limited uptime.|tags:PvE

//Commemoration
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): The base mag on this maxes out at 75 rounds (Reconstruction pushes that to 150), which you can achieve by combining a Backup Mag mod with any of the Tactical, Appended, and Extended Mag perks. However, Extended Mag by itself gets you to 72 (144 with Reconstruction), getting you close to the max while still providing you with the ability to use Rampage Spec or Dragonfly Spec to empower your damage dealing perk. If you can't get Extended Mag to roll, put a Backup Mag mod on it, which will boost you to 72 or 75 depending on your Slot 2 roll.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=1840239774,2420895100,1523832109,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=839105230,2420895100,1523832109,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=1840239774,1523832109,3425386926

dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=2420895100,1523832109,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=1523832109,3425386926

//Commemoration
//notes: adam (PvE): The base mag on this maxes out at 75 rounds (Reconstruction pushes that to 150), which you can achieve by combining a Backup Mag mod with any of the Tactical, Appended, and Extended Mag perks. However, Extended Mag by itself gets you to 72 (144 with Reconstruction), getting you close to the max while still providing you with the ability to use Rampage Spec or Dragonfly Spec to empower your damage dealing perk. If you can't get Extended Mag to roll, put a Backup Mag mod on it, which will boost you to 72 or 75 depending on your Slot 2 roll.|tags:PvE
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=1840239774,2420895100,1523832109,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=1840239774,2420895100,1523832109,2848615171

dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=1523832109,2848615171

//Commemoration
//notes: adam (PvP / optimal): PvP heavy bricks give more ammo the higher your mag size, so you will either need Extended Mag here or you will always want a Backup Mag on the weapon to get to max ammo per brick. Extended + Backup Mag gives no extra ammo pickup so if you manage to roll Extended, you are free to use any other mod on the weapon. Under Pressure will always be active, as the ammo you get from a brick is less than half your mag size.|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=1840239774,2420895100,1359896290,1645158859
dimwishlist:item=4230965989&perks=839105230,2420895100,1359896290,1645158859

//Sacred Provenance
//notes: adam (PvE / optimal): One of the best (if not THE best) feeling PvE pulses in the entire game, hell, one of the best feeling PvE primaries of any kind. Make sure you give it a try, especially if you were a fan of Blast Furnace back in the day.  Be sure to put a Counterbalance Mod on it if you don't have Arrowhead Brake in Slot 1, as it has a strong sideways recoil by default. Arrowhead Brake maxes the recoil stat, use a different mod if you have that roll.|tags:PvE
